author: Lindsey Compton
title: Chicago Marathon restaurant specials: Fuel up or recover at these 23 spots
text:
Another year, another Chicago Marathon, another slew of marathon-related restaurant specials. Whether you want to fuel up on carbs, recover with more carbs or sleep in before treating your crazy runner friends to Sunday afternoon brunch, these Chicago restaurants have just what you'll need.
Ada St.: Start up your engine on Oct. 10 with a pre-marathon four-course menu ($40) that includes steak tartare with fried capers, pork ribs with agave glaze and chipotle grits, pretzel bread pudding with maple whipped cream and one cocktail or glass of wine. 1664 N. Ada St., 7773-697-7069.
Adamus: Receive 26.2 percent off your bill at weekend brunch, which features cardamom-soaked brioche French toast, steak and eggs, fried chicken and waffles and the restaurant’s signature Bloody Mary. 10 S. Wabash Ave., 312-372-7696.
American Craft Kitchen & Bar: Enjoy a pre-race pasta plate from 3-10 p.m. on Oct. 10. The location is offering a pasta buffet ($19.95) that includes a variety of soups, salads, pastas, desserts and freshly baked breads. The price includes non-alcoholic beverages, such as tea or coffee. 151 E. Upper Wacker Dr., 312-565-1234.
Bistronomic: Oct. 9-11, the restaurant is offering a Chicago Marathon menu of four dishes — including linguine with organic Amish chicken, winter root vegetables and mushroom sauce — for $26 each ($14.50 for lunch portions). Call for more information. 840 N. Wabash Ave., 312-944-8400.
Cochon Volant: Chicago Marathon runners: From Oct. 9-11, receive 10 percent off your meal with proof of marathon participation. Special to the menu at dinner on Oct. 10 is a triple pasta with black truffle ($17.95). 100 W. Monroe St., 312-754-6560.
Connie’s Pizza: For $9.99, make a pasta bowl with your choice of noodles and housemade sauce, and sides of salad and bread. Add chicken and meatballs for $3.99 or shrimp for $4.99. The special runs at the Gold Coast and Archer Avenue locations only, Oct. 9-11. 1030 N. State Parkway, 312-326-3443; 2373 S. Archer Ave., 312-326-3443.
County Barbeque: An #AllTheCarbs menu ($24) features a choice of pulled pork or chopped brisket sandwich with garlic or sweet potato fries, plus corn pudding, mac ‘n' cheese and bread pudding with bourbon banana. Purchase a Lone Star beer with a shot of Old Grand-Dad Bonded Bourbon for $5. 1352 W. Taylor St., 312-929-2528.
Dolce Italian: The Carb Marathon special, running 5-8 p.m. Oct. 9-10, is a three-course prix fixe dinner ($35), featuring options such as meatballs, spaghetti al pomodoro and fettuccine alla Bolognese. Reservations are highly recommended. 127 W. Huron St., 312-754-0700.
Dough Bros: From Oct. 9-11, Chicago Marathon participants with proof of registration score buy-one-get-one-free pizza slices. 400 N. State St., 312-600-9078.
Filini Bar & Restaurant: Choose any of six dishes from Filini's Fuel Up menu, including sweet potato gnocchi or risotto carbonara with prosciutto, peas and egg yolk, for $22. All pastas are served with garlic bread. Open for lunch 11 a.m.-2 p.m., and for dinner 5-10 p.m. 221 N. Columbus Dr., 312-477-0234.
Howells & Hood: On Oct. 9-10 from 11 a.m. to midnight, specials include Slagel Family Farms lasagna with veal, cheese, housemade pasta, San Marzano tomatoes and basil; and pasta e Fagioli with pancetta, navy beans, garlic, red chili, tomatoes and pecorino. 435 N. Michigan Ave., 312-262-5310.
Kanela: From Oct. 9-11 at all Kanela locations, enjoy a power waffle (a buckwheat waffle with bananas, almonds and yogurt) for $10. The restaurant is also offering a wheatgrass smoothie for $6. Check website for locations, www.kanelabreakfastclub.com .
La Stanza: Celebrate with a post-race dinner and receive a complimentary appetizer (your runner ID is required). Available Oct. 11-18. 535 N. Michigan Ave, www.lastanzachicago.com.
Lockwood Restaurant and Bar: The restaurant's Elite Menu ($16) features endless pasta from 5-11 p.m. on Oct. 10. Options include short rib Bolognese, pasta puttanesca with olive and San Marzano tomatoes, and more. Palmer House Hilton, 17 E. Monroe St., 312-917-3404.
Lottie’s: On Oct. 11, runners who show their runner ID will receive a 26.2 percent discount for their entire group. Additional specials include $2.62 drafts and $2.62 marathon punch from 11 a.m. to noon. 1925 W. Cortland St., 773-489-0738.
Mk Restaurant: An all-you-can-eat pasta menu ($28) on Oct. 10 includes gemelli pasta with bison sugo, eggplant Bolognese and more. On Oct. 11, the dinner special is a grilled Kobe beef hanger steak with truffle baked potato and rosemary jus ($47). All runners will receive a complimentary glass of sparkling Domaine St. Vincent Brut with their meal. 868 N. Franklin St., 312-482-9179.
Osteria La Madia: After the race, bring in your medal or bib for a free treat from Firecakes Donuts; valid Oct. 11 only. 59 W. Grand Ave.; 312-329-0400.
Park Grill: The restaurant will host its third annual Bank of America Chicago Marathon pre-race pasta dinner on The Plaza at Millenium Park on Oct. 10; seatings are offered at 4 p.m., 6 p.m. and 8 p.m. For $40, enjoy a pasta buffet, including butter lettuce salad, roasted garlic mozzarella bread, grilled vegetables and baked mac and cheese cavatappi, plus your choice of Goose Island beer or The Naked Grape wine. 11 N. Michigan Ave., 312-521-7275, www.parkgrillchicago.com/events .
River Roast: Present your finishing medal on Oct. 11 to receive a Bloody Mary served with a crackling garnish. 315 N. Lasalle St., 312-822-0100.
Rockit Bar & Grill: Marathon specials, running Oct. 8-10, include grilled chicken bruschetta with toasted ciabatta, shaved parmesan and balsamic reduction ($11) and lobster gnocchi with asparagus, crimini mushroom and tomato cream ($24). 22 W. Hubbard St., 312-645-6000.
Sweetwater Tavern and Grille: From 11 a.m. to midnight Oct. 9 and 10 a.m. to midnight Oct. 10, guests can choose from a variety of specials, including smoked Atlantic salmon with capers, shallots, fresh dill, white wine and chevre over angel hair pasta. 225 N. Michigan Ave., 312-698-7111.
David Burke's Primehouse: The morning of the race, runners receive a complimentary grab-and-go breakfast that includes muffins, fruit, yogurt and croissants. Post-race, the restaurant is offering a protein-filled dinner for $70 featuring a 26-ounce, 26-day dry-aged ribeye named after Pheidippides, the Greek messenger fabled to have run the first marathon. The James Chicago, 55 E.. Ontario St., 312-337-1000; David Burke’s Primsehouse, 610 N. Rush St., 312-660-6000.
The Pony: Runners can enjoy a post-marathon happy hour (11 a.m. to noon on Oct. 11) featuring $1 mimosas and $1 frosty mugs. 1638 W. Belmont Ave.; 773-828-5055.
